meanings.definition: The distinctive taste of a food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The ice cream had a sweet flavor.
meanings.sent2: I love the flavor of fresh strawberries.
meanings.sent3: The spicy flavor of the salsa made my mouth tingle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter added a delightful flavor to the party.
meanings.sent5: The flavor of nostalgia filled the air as they reminisced about old times.

meanings.definition: A particular quality or characteristic that gives something its unique appeal.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a unique flavor that set it apart from others.
meanings.sent2: His writing style has a distinct flavor that readers enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist added an interesting flavor to the story.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork had a vibrant and colorful flavor that captivated viewers.
meanings.sent5: The city's rich history adds a fascinating flavor to its culture.

meanings.definition: To enhance or improve the taste of something by adding flavor.
meanings.sent1: She likes to flavor her dishes with fresh herbs.
meanings.sent2: Adding a pinch of salt can really flavor the soup.
meanings.sent3: He tried to flavor his coffee with cinnamon, but it didn't taste right.
meanings.sent4: The chef decided to flavor the sauce with a hint of garlic.
meanings.sent5: The baker used vanilla extract to flavor the cupcakes perfectly.
